Calculate and interpret probabilities of a normal distribution using technology within the

context of a problem.

BC04C438CC9F467196357766D4AC9F35.description:

5E7CB0C7290746EFB9D391EF91BEC1C2.description: Calculate the mean and standard deviation for binomial distributions.

34AD2957B31A4F768DCF769BCE65A3D8.description:
Calculate and interpret the mean (expected value) and standard deviation for a discrete
random variable within the context of a problem.

42E03B036CA84B8CBEAA886C6199466E.description:
Identify discrete random variables and create a table to represent valid discrete probability
distributions within the context of a problem.

98204C98068743EF93CB66DE1316CEC5.description:
The student will represent and interpret situations using discrete random distributions,
including binomial distributions.

26056552FA6B4FE7BA8C30965D64AFC3.description:
Calculate conditional probabilities to determine the association or independence of two
events.

867D124A9C374A09B5D98A8CECD1D866.description:
Apply the addition rule, the multiplication rule, and complementary rule to calculate
probabilities.

E45B150DE7F74F2CB5209E05EE7E1DC8.description:
Represent and calculate probabilities using Venn diagrams, tree diagrams, and two-way
tables.

D8CC576AEA1241AEA924FB34F9CA473B.description:
Given two or more events, determine whether the events are complementary, dependent,
independent, and/or mutually exclusive, and compute the probability of those events.

7F86A7E388D74AFA993B97E32510D6AE.description:
The student will organize information and apply probability rules to compute
probabilities of events within the context of a problem.

377E6705521043DA85EFBF5C1D47E475.description:

as extrapolation.

106C9FA493CC4130A2010EBE0687C358.description:
Using technology, calculate and interpret the coefficient of determination, r
2
, within the
context of a problem.

8E3E26B0EECF4F12B0F1F160881D2C99.description:
Using technology, calculate and interpret the correlation coefficient, r, within the context of a
problem.

92865A13E08C4001BE59DC48D9A7DAC2.description:
Create the least squares regression model using technology to interpret the contextual
meaning of the slope and y-intercept.

5DC9D9770F204155AE4495CA34099FFA.description:
The student will create and interpret a linear model using the least squares regression
method to assess the relationship between two quantitative variables

the presence of unusual features within the data (e.g., clusters, gaps, influential points,
outliers).

74388B0BB90E4432A3DC998A658A9630.description:
The student will represent and analyze quantitative bivariate data with scatterplots to
identify and describe the relationship between two variables.

9BF110109B1F402BBA30B5C7B042DB72.description:
Calculate and interpret marginal, relative, and conditional frequencies to analyze data in a
two-way table within the context of a problem.

A54419544FDC4939B57717489A8D522E.description:
Generate and interpret a two-way table as a summary of the information obtained from two
categorical variables.

D8894EE323D84847AE62D810F6C416B0.description:
Create and interpret graphical displays comparing distributions of two or more univariate
categorical data sets including segmented and side-by-side bar graphs within the context of
the problem, using appropriate technology.

C5B8E34C00464CCE947490CCB9C3A4E6.description:
Create and interpret graphical displays of univariate categorical data, including bar graphs
within the context of the problem, using appropriate technology.

5CD493FCD0C44F5BB2D2CBFB9FC1FB88.description:
The student will represent and analyze categorical data, using two-way tables and
other graphical displays, to describe patterns and relationships.

821EACF5840E4D01A31A9A5893E20341.description: unusual features of the data (e.g., clusters, gaps, outliers).

8730BF036F654D46B059C661CBD10D56.description:
Compare and contrast two or more univariate data sets, numerically and graphically, within
the context of a problem by analyzing:

81964EA7D35941778E723D2C3AA2164C.description:
Create graphical displays of data, including back-to-back stemplots, parallel dot plots, parallel
boxplots, and histograms, using appropriate technology.

36BA6AEB806B4446AA02305EA4E5646A.description:
The student will represent, compare, and analyze distributions of two or more
univariate quantitative data sets, numerically and graphically.

09C1D8FCA3924C66B0950A5A8630AE75.description:
Investigate and explain ways in which standard deviation addresses variability by examining
the formula for standard deviation.

833BD644A021496BB1925F741E7A9D34.description: Investigate and explain the influence of outliers on a univariate data set.

26C368E8C1344B08A02987548FAAE96B.description: Identify possible outliers, using an algorithm.

F9C54683BEED4A348386C9F2D2DF6272.description: Interpret measures of spread: range, interquartile range, variance, and standard deviation.

D7508A47DC0B431DA5815748E78EE764.description: Interpret measures of central tendency: mean, median, and mode.

628C7E74BE2B4F549F270F60B9F4A52B.description:
The student will represent and analyze numerical characteristics of univariate
quantitative data sets to describe patterns and departures from patterns within the
context of a problem

020C5D09BF724F638BC5A395C438A079.description: unusual features of the data (e.g., outliers, clusters, gaps).

B68F6DD89881402CAA801858B378819C.description: Examine the graphs within the context of the problem by analyzing:

2CC84EEA152C46BD8F614016B13F9CBA.description:
Create and interpret graphical displays of data, including dot plots, stemplots, boxplots,
cumulative frequency graphs, and histograms, using appropriate technology.

8126EB04E9C3424791DA0A61188995C2.description:
The student will represent and analyze data visualizations of univariate quantitative
data, including dot plots, stemplots, boxplots, cumulative frequency graphs, and
histograms, to identify and describe patterns and departures from patterns, using
central tendency, spread, clusters, gaps, and outliers, within the context of a
problem.

B86C91BDB85841B58F71518E50AD9717.description: Select a data collection method appropriate for a given context.

1D806E8ACF0A4D19BC54BDF6048FADE5.description:
Use the statistical cycle to plan and conduct a well-designed experiment to answer a question
or address a problem.

61499B8E0F9A4658B3672C7753C0B81B.description:
Compare and contrast controlled experiments and observational studies and the conclusions
that may be drawn from each.

96DC0CA266CC4F78B9F07D918A45D5BA.description:
Evaluate the principles of experimental design to address comparison, randomization,
replication, and control within the context of the problem.

BDA4A4C9C34840079C9DF55F8BD637C4.description: blocking/matched pairs and completely randomized designs.

B42689EE22D04932AEE28FE08DF466A5.description: Describe the principles of experimental design, including:

EC16BDAD6DDA4CF9A584E0B08E3708F2.description:
The student will utilize the principles of experimental design to plan and conduct a
well-designed experiment.

8A5C3EFFA4FB4885B58A4AAB1605F162.description:
Use the statistical cycle to plan and conduct an observational study to answer a question or
address a problem.

1C7B8ADFF270403E8BBFB9F8105D1368.description:
Investigate and explain biased influences inherent within sampling methods and various forms
of response bias.

37D4E1A9D8BB4706942139ADF7F7EE76.description: Determine which sampling technique is best, given a particular context.

9A3F579BFA05410BAF99016A0A1D00A5.description:
Investigate and describe sampling techniques (e.g., simple random sampling, stratified
sampling, systematic sampling, cluster sampling).

BAC56661CB0540EEADB3CD833A048A1B.description:
The student will compare and contrast data collection methods to plan and conduct
an observational study.

3DDD5E3ED5354445B9D60390650F45AF.description: Identify and explain constraints of the statistical approach.

8B7DF5F1A4DC44CCB33181E09A6119CE.description: Compare and contrast population and sample, and parameter and statistic.

CA2C7593297C462F81784B9E5D65F2C3.description:
Understand the type of data relevant to the question at hand (e.g., quantitative versus
categorical).

3E861E3EE18943B787403ABD18167740.description: Formulate questions and conclusions based on context.

9405C70A4A3F4550A112A76C1594A756.description: Define the stages of the statistical cycle and how each stage relates to the others.

B4285533B86C45F196EE986FB42BD414.description:
The student will use a statistical cycle to formulate questions, describe types of data,
data sources, and constraints within the context of a problem.
